title: iOS: SKCanvas.Clear() does nothing
body:
### Description

I have an UITableViewCell with an SKCanvasView in it. When I scroll the list, the cells are reused. Thus the canvas already contains an old image. If I do `canvas.Clear()` without specifying a color, then it should use SKColor.Empty which is transparent. I'd expect an empty transparent canvas at this point, but it seems like the initial contents are opaque black and if the canvas already contained something, these contents are not removed.

The same happens if I do `canvas.Clear(SKColors.Transparent)`.
`canvas.Clear(SKColors.White)` works (but I need to know the page color at this point).
On Android `canvas.Clear()` works as expected.

### Code

    SKCanvas canvas;
    canvas.Clear();

### Expected Behavior

The canvas's contents are removed and replaced with a completely transparent color. If I then draw something to it, then I should only see what I drew and the background should be the color of the page.

### Actual Behavior

The background color is black and not transparent. If the canvas already contained something, then these contents are not removed. New content which I draw to the canvas after the Clear call will be upon it.

### Basic Information

- Version with issue:  1.68.0
- IDE:  VS2019 Preview 1
- Platform Target Frameworks:
  - iOS:  12.1
- Target Devices:
  -   iPad Pro 9,7

### Reproduction Link

[Skia_Svg.zip](https://github.com/mono/SkiaSharp/files/2663528/Skia_Svg.zip)
The repro project displays some .svg or .png images in a SKCanvasView.
On iOS the page background color is white, but the SKCanvasView's are black. If you scroll down and back up, then you see that the old contents are overwritten and not removed.
On Android this works as expected.

The code which does the `canvas.Clear()` is in the beginning of the `Utils.DrawImage(...)` method in the iOS and Android projects respectively. The code is the same for both platforms.
